name: Lágafellslaug - Mosfellsbær Swimming Complex
description: Lágafellslaug stands as Mosfellsbær's premier aquatic and fitness facility, offering a comprehensive swimming complex with multiple pools, extensive waterslides, and integrated World Class gym facilities that make it a popular destination for families, fitness enthusiasts, and visitors exploring the greater Reykjavík area. Located in Mosfellsbær—a rapidly growing municipality of approximately 12,000 residents situated about 15 kilometers east of central Reykjavík along Route 1 (the Ring Road)—the facility serves a community known for its proximity to outdoor recreation including hiking in Esjan mountain, exploring lava caves at Víðgelmir, and accessing highland routes. The swimming complex exemplifies modern Icelandic aquatic design with specialized pools serving different user groups and purposes. The main 25-meter pool accommodates lap swimmers, aquatic fitness classes, and general recreational swimming with comfortable year-round temperature maintained through geothermal heating that makes outdoor swimming pleasurable even during Iceland's coldest months. A unique 16-meter pool features an adjustable bottom that can be raised or lowered to different depths, making it ideal for swimming instruction where water level can be customized to student comfort and skill levels—during scheduled lessons this pool is reserved for instruction, but it opens to general public use during non-lesson hours. A dedicated shallow children's pool equipped with various play features including fountains.
